summary: cyberpunk 2077 came out of absolutely nowhere to punch me in the face with incredible character customization and awesome...
body:
cyberpunk 2077 came out of absolutely nowhere to punch me in the face with incredible character customization and awesome fucking graphics so i’m short 60 more bucks now and i don’t regret it

previously it was like “that sounds kinda cool”

cyberpunk 2077: “you can play as a female and customize tf out of it”

me: okay now you’ve got me *finger guns* tell me more

blog.name: queenbol
blog.title: What was I gonna say?
blog.description: Honestly I just post whatever I fucking want nowadays.

body:
I WANNA!!!

TALK ABOUT MY CYBERPUNK V!!

She used to be part of a legitimate gang, until she met and fell in love with a waitress at her local eatery. She was tough, loud and had a heart of gold that was sweeter than anything and my V fell fucking hard.

Eventually she ends up leaving the gang for her, and they move away to get away from that life and get married, and spend an amazing few years together, building a life for themselves. But the gang caught up, and V got her throat cut in their home and watched her wife die as she bled out. V survives out of pure rage, grief and spite, and makes it her life’s mission to track down the men who killed the love of her life and destroy them and everything they care about.

Which leads her to Night City, and she knows if she wants to take down a whole gang, she needs eddies, influence and firepower. She draws on her old skills as a bruiser from her old days, and she will brand Night City with her mark, bringing justice to those who wronged her. She never thought she’d find a friend like Jackie- nor did she ever expect to fall in love again. But she was always weak to the tough, kind-hearted type.

blog.name: queenbol
blog.title: What was I gonna say?
blog.description: Honestly I just post whatever I fucking want nowadays.

tags: i dont think they'd spoil a main character death like that in a trailer
summary: Everyone upset that Jackie dies in the trailer, thinking that it's set in stone! I don't think he's bound to die- I just think...
body:
Everyone upset that Jackie dies in the trailer, thinking that it’s set in stone! I don’t think he’s bound to die- I just think they want to show that Jackie CAN die, depending on your choices. Witcher was full of difficult decisions, and they say Cyberpunk is going to super choice heavy and the world can and will change depending on what you do and who you align yourself with.

And I’m telling you now save files exist for a reason and I’m sure as hell going to make sure my future 3d husband is going to live for-fucking-ever.

reblog.comment:

And I’m telling you now save files exist for a reason and I’m sure as hell going to make sure my future 3d husband is going to live for-fucking-ever.

And I’m telling you now save files exist for a reason and I’m sure as hell going to make sure my future 3d husband is going to live for-fucking-ever.

And I’m telling you now save files exist for a reason and I’m sure as hell going to make sure my future 3d husband is going to live for-fucking-ever.

blog.name: turianfetish

blog.description:
JAGODA | POLAND | ENFJ


MASS EFFECT | DRAGON AGE | THE WITCHER | HP | DEUS EX | STAR WARS | GAME OF THRONES | MARVEL | and other stories


This is NOT a spoiler-free blog!

summary: SPOILERS on the main plot and Johnny Silverhand’s fate from the new demo
title: SPOILERS on the main plot and Johnny Silverhand’s fate from the new demo
body:
• So apparently, early in the game V gets implanted - against their will - with a biochip that holds the secret to immortality
  • They are being haunted (in a way) by Johnny Silverhand who speaks to you in your head a lot, comments on your choices and sometimes appears as a hologram and does stuff in the background (for now it’s not confirmed if he can actually affect the environment)
  • It’s safe to assume that his presence is connected with the immortality chip and main plot
  • You can hear his comments in the character creation screen, which may mean that we won’t get to see our character before they get chipped, probably in the first mission of the game
  • As pointed out by radio presenter in 2018 gameplay, Johnny has been gone since a year before (there’s grafitti saying ‘Where is Johnny?’ in the new demo) and now is likely dead, since he basically inhabits V’s mind

  • As pointed out by radio presenter in 2018 gameplay, Johnny has been gone since a year before (there’s grafitti saying ‘Where is Johnny?’ in the new demo) and now is likely dead, since he basically inhabits V’s mind

blog.name: turianfetish
blog.title: I have a turian fetish.
blog.description:
JAGODA | POLAND | ENFJ


MASS EFFECT | DRAGON AGE | THE WITCHER | HP | DEUS EX | STAR WARS | GAME OF THRONES | MARVEL | and other stories


This is NOT a spoiler-free blog!

summary: Cool fully non-spoilery bits from the new gameplay demo
title: Cool fully non-spoilery bits from the new gameplay demo
body:
• You can change V’s hair color, skin color, eye color, and facial features. There are lots of facial customization options.
  • Life path choice may open up an alternate dialogue option.

  • There’s real-time translation of someone talking to you in Creol, thanks to an implant chip. They speak it and you just read subtitles.

  • There are lots of shops to find, and more stuff unlocks as your street cred goes up.

  • There are lots of clothing customization options.

  • There’s a fully dynamic day and night cycle. Sunset looks nice.

  • Motorcycle driving looks fairly arcadey and sort of stiff.

  • When riding a motorcycle, you can change the radio to listen to different stations and can swap between first and third-person perspectives.

  • You can travel across the whole world freely and seamlessly with no loading screens.

  • “Players can play the entire game without killing an enemy if you wish.”

  • Hacking minigame confirmed: there’s a grid of hex codes that you pick out the right ones for. Completing the basic level will give you access but you can get more optional benefits for doing even better.

  • You can use the environment to distract enemies.

  • You can use perk points earned on level-ups to upgrade a number of categories: blades, rifles, handguns, assassination, cold-blood, sniper rifles, engineering, hacking, shotgun melee, two-handed (and most likely some more).

  • The level-up skill tree is a branching thing that looks like a motherboard almost, with cables going out from the center.

  • Perks also affect dialogue options.
